result_list.explanation: Le Duc de Nemours paraît – This indicates the character entering the stage.
Air du commencement – This refers to a tune or song title, indicating a music stage direction.
À Francis et à Madeleine – This indicates the addressees of a potential speech or interaction.
Il parle à ses soldats – This shows interaction through verbal communication with characters.
Lui montrant une lettre – This suggests the character is handling an object (the letter) and showing it to another character.
AIR. ( Quand Iris prend plaisir à boire. ) – Again, this refers to a tune or song, fitting in the music category.
result_list.stgdir: AIR. ( Quand Iris prend plaisir à boire. )

result_list.explanation: AIR : La plus belle promenade – This is another music direction indicating a specific air or song.
Il frappe avec sa batte – This indicates a violent action, fitting the aggression category.
Il tourne les yeux sur Henry – This indicates a movement of the character's gaze, which falls into the movement category.
result_list.stgdir: Il tourne les yeux sur Henry.

result_list.explanation: AIR 119. Et autre chose itou – Similar to the others, this indicates a musical element.
